content.webTitle: Spanish media round on Camacho's team

fields.headline: Spanish media round on Camacho's team
fields.bodyText: The Spanish media have rounded on their national side following their 3-0 defeat by England last night. "Spain slumps into total discredit," read the headline in El Pais on Thursday. "No play, no goals, no motivation, nothing at all," complained sports daily As, while its rival Marca raised the question: "Why do Spanish clubs triumph and the national side always fail?" What has made the defeat all the more galling, according to the Spanish media, is that the resounding defeat came against a England team suffering one of the worst crises in their long history. "England, who have done nothing recently, and who lack experience with a new coach, taught us a severe lesson, a defeat that should leave us red-faced and with our heads low," Marca said. "We played ball, while they played football," was Spain coach Jose Antonio Camacho's apt assessment of the game.
